then.description: Simple robbery, as defined in Art. 140 ciph. 1 StGB provides a sentence length with a minimum 6 months and maximum of 10 years. The maximum may be increased by later developments, but may never exceed 20 years.

Robbery can be qualified in three main ways. All of these hold a maximum sentence length of 20 years. This cannot be exceeded by any further developments under Art. 40 ciph. 2 StGB. If the robbery was qualified in more than one way, then the highest sentence frame holds.
As described in Art. 140 ciph. 2 StGB, the usage of a firearm or other dangerous weapon in a robbery results in a sentence of 1 to 20 years.

As described in Art. 140 ciph. 3 StGB, if the offender commits robbery as part of a group organised for the purpose of robbery, or if the offender represents a particular danger in the way the robbery was committed then the resulting sentence is from 2 to 20 years.
As described in Art. 140 ciph. 4 StGB, if the offender endangered the life of a victim during the robbery, then the resulting sentence if from 5 to 20 years.
No additional crimes are included in this sentencing, leading to no increase in the penalty frame.
Additional crimes with lesser base sentences were included in this sentencing. This leads to an increase of 50% in the sentence length, in accordance with Art. 49 ciph. 1 StGB.
The motives for the crime were deemed to be honourable. As such, a 20% deduction to the sentence frame is implemented.
The perpetrator committed the crime whilst seriously distressed. As such a 10% deduction to the sentence frame is implemented.
The perpetrator committed the crime whilst under serious threat. As such a 10% deduction to the sentence frame is implemented.
The perpetrator committed the crime at the behest of someone to whom they were dependent or duty bound. A 3% deduction to the sentence frame is implemented.
The offender was seriously provoked by the conduct of the person suffering injury. A 4% deduction to the sentence frame is implemented.
The perpetrator committed the crime whilst in a state of extreme emotion or psychological stress. A 15% deduction to the sentence frame is implemented.
The perpetrator has shown genuine remorse for the crime, and has made reparations. A 10% deduction to the sentence frame is implemented.
The need for punishment has been substantially reduced due to the elapsed time since the offence. A 7% deduction to the sentence frame is implemented.
Due to the value of the stolen items being lower than CHF 300, the sentence is skewed towards the minimum.
Due to the value of the items being between CHF 300 and CHF 10000, the sentence is skewed towards the middle.
Due to the value of the items being greater than CHF 10000, the sentence is skewed towards the maximum.

Due to the high level of danger posed by the perpetrator, the sentence frame is skewed towards the maximum.

Due to the medium likelihood of the potential danger happening, the sentence is skewed towards the lower middle.
Due to the severe likelihood of the potential danger happening, the sentence is skewed towards the upper middle.
Due to the very severe likelihood of the potential danger happening, the sentence is skewed towards the maximum.

The perpetrators motives fall under the category of "Emotional Reasons", this does not give reason to suspect high criminal intent, and as such the sentence is skewed towards the middle.
The perpetrators motives fall under the category of "Personal Gain", this gives reason to suspect high criminal intent, and as such the sentence is skewed towards the maximum.

The perpetrators motives fall under the category of "Mental Impairment" and the perpetrator is believed to have been lucid during the crime. This does not give reason to suspect high criminal intent, and as such the sentence is skewed towards the minimum.
The perpetrator is not believed to have been lucid during the crime. This suggests that an error was made during the judgement and no sentence should be given.
Whilst the offender cooperated with the authorities, this was in a situation where the amount of proof was overwhelming. Therefore no deduction from the sentence is made.
Whilst the offender did not cooperate with the authorities, they did this through passive behaviour and as such no addition is made to the sentence. This is in accordance to Art. 113 ciph. 1 StPO

The offender cooperated with the authorities, despite there being little or no proof. This results in a 30% deduction from the final sentence. This is estimated in accordance to constant jurisprudence.
The offender actively hindered or disrupted the authorities, resulting in a 10% increase in the sentence. This is estimated in accordance to constant jurisprudence.
The offender has no past record, this results in no increase to the sentence.
Due to the offenders past record, the sentence is increased by 10%. This is estimated in accordance to constant jurisprudence.
The offender has people dependent on their care, this leads to a 20% reduction in the sentence. This is estimated in accordance to constant jurisprudence.
As the offender has no one dependent on their care, no reduction is made to the sentence.
Due to the perceived impact of the punishment having normal, or below average impact on the offender, no reduction is made to the sentence.
Due to the perceived above average negative impact on the offenders future life, the sentence is reduced by 10%. This is estimated in accordance to constant jurisprudence.
